name: disapproved
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
disapprove
B2 to feel that something or someone is bad, wrong, etc.: The survey showed that 32 percent of respondents approve, 54 percent disapprove, and the rest are undecided. I strongly disapprove of underage drinking. Opposite
approve (HAVE A GOOD OPINION)
More examplesFewer examplesI disapprove of all the violence that is shown on television.He claims he was forced to leave his job by a group of students who disapproved of his views.Sex before marriage is strongly disapproved of in some cultures.He always disapproves of any new ideas suggested by anyone below him in the department.I didn't suggest that we held the party here, as I knew you would disapprove.
